revised_title: The Absorption of Gases by Charcoal: Historical Review and Experiments
tldr: This article discusses the historical significance and experiments conducted on the absorption of gases by charcoal. The author explores the oxidizing powers of porous bodies, the purification of liquids, and the action of charcoal on gases and vapors. The experiments reveal the remarkable ability of charcoal to selectively absorb oxygen and expel other gases, providing insights into the causes of spontaneous combustion and the potential for air purification.
